item.metadata:author: Ari Levy
item.title: Ex-Apple employees are attacking the mask shortage problem, and they're starting with rubber bands
item.description: The founders of Fix The Mask are holed up together in a San Francisco apartment working on developing a safe and easy protective mask.

item.metadata:author: Tyler Clifford
item.title: Cramer's week ahead: This earnings week will be a 'tougher test'
item.description: "This earnings week is "chock full of tech stocks, including some household names that have run up substantially from their March lows," the "Mad Money" host said.

item.title: The Final Call: AAPL, DIS & M
item.description: The Options Action traders give their final trades heading into next week.

item.title: Chartmaster warns Apple shares may get squeezed on its earnings next week, here's why
item.description: Cornerstone Macro's Carter Worth on Apple's moment of truth. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Options Action traders, Mike Khouw and Tony Zhang.

item.metadata:author: Melissa Lee
item.title: Cornerstone Macro's Carter Worth charts where Big Tech is headed
item.description: Carter Worth, Cornerstone Macro, on where the charts are pointing for Big Tech. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Guy Adami, Tim Seymour, Brian Kelly and Jeff Mills.

item.metadata:author: Melissa Lee
item.title: Big Tech reports next week, here's what to watch for
item.description: Getting ready for next week's Big Tech earnings. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Guy Adami, Tim Seymour, Brian Kelly and Jeff Mills.

item.metadata:author: Fred Imbert
item.title: Here's what happened to the stock market on Friday
item.description: Stocks closed higher as oil extended its rebound from historic lows, but still posted their first weekly loss in three.

item.metadata:author: Patti Domm
item.title: Stocks face headwinds as investors look forward to a big earnings week, a Fed meeting and state reopenings
item.description: Stocks head into a week full of big events, including a Fed meeting, earnings from Microsoft, Apple and Amazon, and first-quarter gross domestic product numbers.

item.title: Trump: Tim Cook says he thinks economy will have V-shaped recovery
item.description: CNBC's Eamon Javers reports on recent comments from President Trump on Apple CEO Tim Cook, helping out the oil and airlines industries and coronavirus treatment.

item.metadata:author: Jessica Bursztynsky
item.title: Trump says he talked to Apple CEO Tim Cook, who predicts a V-shaped recovery after coronavirus
item.description: Trump said he and Cook spoke on Friday about economic recovery.

item.metadata:credit: David Paul Morris | Bloomberg | Getty Images
item.metadata:author: Kif Leswing
item.title: Apple and Google are tweaking plans for tech to help officials track coronavirus exposure
item.description: Apple and Google still plan to release APIs to let governments use signals picked up from smartphones to alert people who may have been exposed to someone infected with Covid-19. On Friday, they announced some privacy tweaks and other changes.

item.title: Apple says there's 'no evidence' iPhone mail flaw was used against customers
item.description: Apple said on Thursday it has found "no evidence" a flaw in its email app for iPhones and iPads has been used against customers, and that it believes the flaw does "not pose an immediate risk to our users."

item.metadata:author: Sam Shead
item.title: Britain's Royal Air Force tests virus-tracing app but privacy concerns remain
item.description: A Royal Air Force base in England is testing a coronavirus contact-tracing app on behalf on the National Health Service.

item.metadata:author: J.R. Reed
item.title: Tech companies pull back on hiring, flashing another grim warning sign for the U.S. economy
item.description: An additional 4.4 million Americans filed for jobless claims last week, bringing the total to 26 million over the past five weeks. And, despite the shift to remote work and the surge in demand for certain online services, tech is not immune to the pullback. Jobs openings nationwide across the industry dropped more than 20 percent between mid-March and mid-April, according to analysts at Glassdoor.

item.metadata:author: Deirdre Bosa
item.title: Canadian tech rises again as Shopify becomes the second-most valuable company in Canada
item.description: Shopify is bigger than all the Canadian banks but one -- Royal Bank of Canada -- and it's quickly closing in.

item.metadata:author: Lauren Thomas
item.title: 4 reasons retail in the US won't be bouncing back like in China
item.description: While America's retail industry is looking to China for clues about how shoppers are rebounding from the coronavirus pandemic, there are shortcomings to using the region as a blueprint.

item.metadata:author: Todd Haselton
item.title: Apple's new Magic Keyboard is expensive but will change how you work on your iPad Pro
item.description: If you're like me, and you've longed to use an iPad as a tablet sometimes and a computer at others, then the Magic Keyboard is a buy. If you just need a keyboard sometimes and don't care much about the mouse support, get Apple's Smart Keyboard, which starts at $179.

item.metadata:credit: Tom Williams | CQ Roll Call | Getty Images
item.metadata:author: Lauren Feiner
item.title: House antitrust chairman says most mergers should be banned during the pandemic
item.description: Rep. David Ciciline, D-R.I., is leading a probe into competitive practices at Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Google parent company Alphabet.

item.metadata:credit: Scott Strazzante | The San Francisco Chronicle via Getty Images
category: Dow Jones US Soft Drinks Index
item.metadata:author: Lora Kolodny, William Feuer, Kevin Breuninger, Amanda Macias
item.title: California reports 'deadliest day' yet, global lockdowns ease
item.description: Covid-19 has infected more than 2.7 million people around the world as of Thursday, killing at least 190,303 people.

item.metadata:author: Melissa Lee
item.title: Charts on China congestion, pollution levels could be indicators
item.description: Charts that could be indicative of life after Covid-19 and the possibility that key chipmaker is picking up production. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Guy Adami, Tim Seymour, Brian Kelly and Steve Grasso.

item.metadata:author: Lauren Feiner
item.title: Facebook and Amazon lead Big Tech lobbying in the first quarter while Google scales down
item.description: The new tally comes as the coronavirus pandemic has made many workers more reliant on the internet than ever.

item.metadata:author: Todd Haselton
item.title: Apple's new cheap iPhone is an incredible value
item.description: It offers incredible value for the price and will last you for at least three years. If you can afford to spend more, Apple sells better phones, but the iPhone SE offers a great balance of features and price.

item.metadata:author: Thomas Franck, Fred Imbert, Yun Li
item.title: Stock market live Wednesday: Dow up 450, oil rebounds from deep rout, Facebook pops 6%
item.description: Stocks rebounded as oil markets stabilized, with prices bouncing off their multi-year lows.

item.metadata:author: Evelyn Cheng
item.title: Beijing city shuts down gyms again as fears rise over a second wave of coronavirus
item.description: China's ballooning fitness industry got hit so hard by the coronavirus that more businesses in the field closed in the first three months of the year than in all of 2015, according to Qichacha.

item.metadata:author: Stephanie Landsman
item.title: These two tech stocks could be the biggest winners despite an 'ugly' earnings season
item.description: Loup Ventures' Gene Munster believes Wall Street is underestimating the coronavirus impact on technology earnings.

item.metadata:author: Melissa Lee
item.title: Traders talk MAGA stocks and the state of the tech sector
item.description: Tech leads today's market sell-off. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Guy Adami, Tim Seymour, Karen Finerman and Dan Nathan.

item.metadata:credit: Tom Williams | CQ-Roll Call via Getty Images
item.metadata:author: Lauren Feiner
item.title: Apple and Google CEOs should be held responsible for protecting coronavirus tracking data, says GOP Sen. Hawley
item.description: The companies have teamed up to release tools allowing developers to create apps notifying users if they have come into contact with someone who has tested positive.

item.metadata:author: Jessica Bursztynsky
item.title: HBO Max will be free for some AT&T subscribers when it launches on May 27
item.description: HBO Max is set to debut with 10,000 hours of content. It's one of the latest to join the crowded streaming market, with the recent launch of Disney+ and Comcast's Peacock set to launch broadly on July 15.

item.metadata:author: Ari Levy, Lauren Hirsch, Yelena Dzhanova
item.title: FDA greenlights first coronavirus test with at-home sample, Trump targets immigration
item.description: Covid-19 has infected 2.5 million around the world as of Tuesday, killing at least 171,810 people.

item.metadata:author: Jennifer Elias
item.title: As Google becomes key infrastructure for new coronavirus relief, old issues haunt it
item.description: Contract tracing solutions largely rest in the hands of Google but its past privacy concerns threaten its chance at success.

item.metadata:author: Ryan Browne
item.title: Facebook launches a dedicated gaming app to take on Twitch and YouTube
item.description: Facebook has launched dedicated app for people to create and watch live gameplay.

item.metadata:credit: David J. Griffin | Icon Sportswire via Getty Images
category: Vanguard FTSE Emerging Markets Index Fund ETF Shares
item.metadata:author: Lora Kolodny, Kevin Stankiewicz, Julia Boorstin
item.title: Georgia governor says some businesses can reopen, California town to test every resident
item.description: Covid-19 has infected more than 2.4 million people around the world, killing at least 168,500 as of Monday, according to data compiled by Johns Hopkins University.

item.metadata:author: Keris Lahiff
item.title: Goldman Sachs says sell Apple, chart analyst says otherwise
item.description: Technical analyst Craig Johnson said consumers waiting for the 5G rollout a possible reason for the current suppressed demand.

item.metadata:author: Lauren Feiner
item.title: Big Tech's goodwill tour won't carry weight in antitrust probes, experts say
item.description: Tech firms have played a key role in the coronavirus response, but antitrust experts say it's unlikely to curry favor with law enforcement.

item.metadata:author: Emma Newburger, Noah Higgins-Dunn, Anna Hecht, Riya Bhattacharjee
item.title: US tops more than 750,000 cases as Trump says he will use DPA to increase medical swabs
item.description: Covid-19 has infected more than 2.3 million around the world as of Sunday, killing at least 164,000 people.

item.metadata:author: Spencer Kimball
item.title: This week's most important reads: Job losses mount and rescue loans run out as coronavirus testing remains short
item.description: This most important news this week: Job losses mount and small business loans run out as coronavirus testing remains short.

item.metadata:author: Lauren Feiner
item.title: New York City businesses are staying open by pitching into coronavirus relief efforts and going virtual
item.description: NYC businesses have been creating face shields, masks and hand sanitizer as their other businesses run dry.

item.metadata:credit: Rich Pedroncelli | AP | Bloomberg via Getty Images
item.metadata:author: William Feuer, Hannah Miller
item.title: California Gov. Gavin Newsom says tech companies are key to lifting coronavirus restrictions
item.description: "If I was talking to you last year, the big debate in this state and by extension this country was the work California was doing to lead in the privacy space," he said.

item.metadata:author: Yasmin Khorram
item.title: California governor names Steyer, Yellen and tech CEOs to business recovery task force
item.description: The task force's goal is to help Californian's recover as fast as possible from the economic calamity resulting from the coronavirus. It will include former Chair of the Federal Reserve Janet Yellen, Disney Executive Chairman Bob Iger and Apple CEO Tim Cook.

item.metadata:author: Todd Haselton
item.title: Apple Music is now available on the web so you don't have to use iTunes
item.description: The new site is convenient for folks who have an iPhone or iPad and normally use the Apple Music app but have otherwise not used the service on a Windows computer where they'd have to download and install Apple's famously sluggish iTunes software.

item.title: Here's an ETF strategy for riding the coattails of the Fed
item.description: Exposure to corporate bonds through ETFs can give portfolios a boost as the Fed takes unprecedented stimulus measures, says one strategist.

item.description: Check out the companies making headlines in midday trading on Friday.

item.title: What to watch today: Dow set to surge after a coronavirus drug reportedly shows effectiveness
item.description: The Dow is set to surge Friday on a report that said Gilead Sciences' drug Remdesivir showed effectiveness in treating Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus updates: Visitors flock to Jacksonville beaches after they reopen for exercise and activity
item.description: Covid-19 has infected more than 2,214,800 around the world as of Friday, killing at least 150,948 people.

item.metadata:author: Keris Lahiff
item.title: Netflix stock charts suggest layer of support in case of a pullback
item.description: Netflix shares keep hitting records. After such a steep run-up, trader Todd Gordon sees a level that should provide cushioning in case of a pullback.

item.metadata:author: Silvia Amaro
item.title: Google told to respect Europe's privacy rules as it works on a coronavirus tracing app
item.description: Google has been pressured to closely follow Europe's data privacy rules with the coronavirus tracing apps that it's developing alongside Apple.

item.metadata:author: Michael Bloom
item.title: Goldman downgrades Apple to sell, predicts nearly 20% drop in stock from here
item.description: Goldman Sachs downgraded Apple to sell due to the coronavirus lockdown and a possibly delay in the 5G iPhone.

item.metadata:author: Jesse Pound
item.title: 'A long way to go' before there's enough testing to reopen economy, Business Roundtable CEO says
item.description: Business Roundtable President and CEO Joshua Bolten discussed what is needed for businesses to reopen on "Power Lunch."
